term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - surface chemical potential
term.title: surface chemical potential

item.text: Defined by: µ i σ = ( ∂ A σ ∂ n i σ ) T , A is the surface excess Helmholtz energy, Gσ is the surface excess Gibbs energyAS is the interfacial Helmholtz energy, GS is the interfacial Gibbs energy, and AS is the surface area. The quantities thus defined can be shown to be identical, and the conditions of equilibrium of component i in the system to beµ i α = µ i σ = µ i S = µ i β and µ i β are the chemical potentials of i in the bulk phases α and β. (µ i α or µ i β have to be omitted from this equlibrium condition if component i is not present in the respective bulk phase.) The surface chemical potentials are related to the Gibbs energy functions by the equations

item.alttext: µ i σ = ( ∂ A σ ∂ n i σ ) T , A
µ i S = ( ∂ A S ∂ n i S ) T , V
µ i α = µ i σ = µ i S = µ i β
